alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 2:41AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, eastern, northeastern, and southeastern Massachusetts, including the following counties, in central Massachusetts, Worcester. In eastern Massachusetts, Middlesex, Norfolk and Suffolk. In northeastern Massachusetts, Essex. In southeastern Massachusetts, Bristol and Plymouth. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 240 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boston, Lowell, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Lawrence, Somerville, Framingham, Haverhill, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Methuen and Arlington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester
